reviews.review_msg: I took bio psych online and Evan was so helpful and detailed with what we were tested on. Gave us multiple short answer and long answer questions for exam so we could be prepared. Even though there was lots of info to learn, he helped us focus on the key components and made taking an online class much clearer. 10/10

Space too small to say enough good things. Simply the best. Where are all the comments? I guess everyone is still speechless. A lot of thought and work went into every aspect of course delivery. Challenging, yes, but quite fair. Lively pace, almost an extreme sport at times. Imagine a class that makes you feel MORE alive? A+, Steven Brown!

I had Bryan at UFV and he certainly challenged, in a somewhat unfair manner, my learning. It appeared that he wanted the class average to fall into a low range. Midterm average was 63%. Hard work did not payoff in this class since his assignmnets were difficult to understand and exams were worded in a confusing way. Little help on what to study!

All self-taught, very short weekly videos, nothing the book didnt say, very broad, book has way more info. Exams are all written so prepare for marks to be taken away even if you get it right. Multiple choice getting the answer right gives you 100 percent of the marks. Exams are too short 6min per SA 15min per LA yet expect tons of detail too

Neil is passionate and clearly loves what he does. Although, I think he expects everyone to be as engaged with the material as he is. Long lectures, lots of readings, and only quizzes and exams. Wish he would have provided smaller assignments to help us understand the material better. If youre not great a memorizing this course is not for you!

Best psychology prof at SFU hands down. Crystal clear, incredibly detailed and knowlegable, had breadth knowledge as well for questions related to class material. Packs an insane amount of information into every class, and you still learn it all!

AWESOME PROF! his lectures are long but they are hilarious not to mention informative. loves his job/area of study. funny. online lectures plus recordings (great help for exam prep). should attend lectures just to hear his jokes.

He is not the greatest professor to have this course with. He is in no way consistent throughout all his lectures and sends multiple follow up emails on the mistakes he made towards marking/quizzes/missed information - showing lack of organization. Does not follow the syllabus, as he changes the way things are based on his liking. BIG NO!

Very monotone,no need to attend lecture barely anyone showed up. Just read the textbook the exam questions are literally from the textbook test bank. He used last years slides, put no effort into the course. I ended up with a B+ but instead of going to lecture I should have just read the textbook over and over because that is what he tests on exams

I am a B student and this was my first class after transferring from Douglas.  WHAT A MISTAKE!!! No need going to class, just read the text, no participation, no assignments, no papers, just multiple choice exams with a couple fill in the blank.  If you need interaction and teaching like I do, then I highly recommend looking elsewhere.

Wow, were his exams hard! You need to memorize the text like crazy! His drawings are terrible, but I preferred his use of the overheard rather than slides because it forced him to SLOW DOWN! I think he just needs experience and feedback.
